comments: She is a really good professor if your into this class u will pass. She teaches very well and definetely gives extra credit for those who do not do well.

school_name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
comments: One of the best JJ Profs I\'ve had so far. Wants students to learn the material and does what is needed to make that happen. Easy IF you work with her. If you show you aren\'t interested she will make things difficult (as it should be). I am very glad I had her as a Prof. (not relevant, but she is VERY easy on the eyes!!!)

school_name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
comments: WOW! Very, very, very nice person. Very, very, very smart Professor. Very, very, very beautiful lady. I have her class right now and I\'m so glad I do! WOW (again)!:)

school_name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
comments: I expected another boring math class, but Shlosberg\'s was pretty fun. She makes every effort to explain the material, backtracking to prior chapters if we seemed lost. The workload was surprisingly light -- a take home test and two class exams -- and she allowed us to redo one of the exams. Take her class if you want a professor that cares.

school_name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
comments: WITH HER STA250 IS NOT A NIGHTMARE, SHE EXPLAINS EVERYTHING SO WELL AND DOES NOT CONFUSE THE STUDENTS. VERY HELPFUL IF YOU DON\'T UNDERSTAND SOMETHING. YOU NEED SOME LUCK TO GET IN HER CLASS THOUGH. EXAMS AND QUIZZES ARE EASY

school_name: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
comments: If you work hard in her class, you will get an A. There is no reason that you will not get the A. She is an enthusiast professor. Knows her materials well and explain well. She gives extra credits for people who do not do well. I highly recommend her and any student who has taken her class will take her again.
